docs.snippet: Conrado Marrero, the diminutive Cuban right-hander who pitched for the Washington Senators in the 1950s and in 2011 became the oldest living former Major League Baseball player, died in Havana on Wednesday. He was 102, just two days short of his 1...
docs.lead_paragraph: Conrado Marrero, the diminutive Cuban right-hander who pitched for the Washington Senators in the 1950s and in 2011 became the oldest living former Major League Baseball player, died in Havana on Wednesday. He was 102, just two days short of his 103rd birthday.

headline.main: Oldest Living Ex-MLB Player Dies in Cuba at 102
headline.print_headline: Oldest Living Ex-MLB Player Dies in Cuba at 102

docs.snippet: Less than two weeks after pitching against Boston with what appeared to be pine tar on his pitching hand, the New York Yankees' Michael Pineda was ejected from a game against the Red Sox on Wednesday night after umpires found a foreign substance o...
docs.lead_paragraph: Less than two weeks after pitching against Boston with what appeared to be pine tar on his pitching hand, the New York Yankees' Michael Pineda was ejected from a game against the Red Sox on Wednesday night after umpires found a foreign substance on his neck.

headline.main: Yanks Pitcher Pineda Ejected for Substance on Neck
headline.print_headline: Yanks Pitcher Pineda Ejected for Substance on Neck

docs.snippet: Yankees pitcher Michael Pineda was ejected for using pine tar less than two weeks after appearing to get away with using a foreign substance in another game against Boston, and the Red Sox beat New York 5-1 on Wednesday night....
docs.lead_paragraph: Yankees pitcher Michael Pineda was ejected for using pine tar less than two weeks after appearing to get away with using a foreign substance in another game against Boston, and the Red Sox beat New York 5-1 on Wednesday night.

headline.main: Pineda Tossed for Pine Tar; Red Sox Beat Yanks 5-1
headline.print_headline: Pineda Tossed for Pine Tar; Red Sox Beat Yanks 5-1
